children.name: glare
children.definition: a bright unpleasant light which hurts your eyes :tia sáng chói
examples: the glare of sth
the harsh glare of the desert sun
a special screen to reduce glare
the glare of the car’s headlights
The heat and glare of the furnace is immense.
Tinted windows will cut downtheglare/the sun's glare.
This screengives offa lot of glare.

children.name: flash
children.definition: a sudden bright light that quickly disappears : tia, vệt, đốm
examples: Two flashes mean danger.
flash of
a flash of lightning
The bomb exploded in a flashofyellow light.
Aflash of lightninglit up the night sky.
a brilliant/ blinding flash
a brilliant flash of light

children.name: halo
children.definition: a circle of light or sth bright : vầng sáng
examples: the halo around the moon
halo of
a halo of sunlight
a halo of blonde curls

children.name: beam
children.definition: a)a line of light shining from the sun, a lamp etc :
examples: sunbeam[C] a beam of light from the sun that you can see : tia nắng
b)a line of light, energy etc that you cannot see :
a laser beam

children.name: beam of
examples: We could see the beams of searchlights scanning the sky.
We could just pick out the path in the weak beam of the UK usually torch/ US flashlight.
The rabbit stopped, mesmerized by the beam of the car's headlights.

children.name: beam of light
examples: Maggie stumbled across the field with only a narrow beam of light from her flashlight to help her.

children.name: glow
children.definition: a soft pleasant light, especially from something that is burning:ánh sáng dịu
examples: glow from
the glow from the dying fire
glow of
the dim glow of the lightbulb
the warm glow of the setting sun
the green glow of the computer monitor

children.name: ray
children.definition: a line of light, especially one shining from the sun:tia sáng
examples: Use a sunscreen to protect your skin against the sun’s harmful rays.
reflected ray[C] specialized a ray (= beam of light) that is reflected from a surface : tia phản xạ

children.name: ray of
examples: The first rays of the sun pierced the canopy of leaves above us, and the forest began to wake up.
A rayofsunshine shone through a gap in the clouds.
Light rays bend as they pass from air to water.

children.name: sunshine
children.definition: the light and heat that come from the sun when there is no cloud : ánh nắng
examples: We had three days of spring sunshine.

children.name: the spring/summer/autumn/winter sunshine
examples: She was sitting in the garden, enjoying the spring sunshine.

children.name: the morning/afternoon/evening sunshine
examples: The morning sunshine brightened the room.

children.name: bright/brilliant/blazing/dazzling sunshine
examples: We stepped out of the plane into the bright sunshine of Corfu.

children.name: glorious sunshine
children.definition: enjoyable bright sunshine
examples: They woke to blue skies and glorious sunshine.

children.name: warm/hot sunshine
examples: Don't spend too long in hot sunshine without a hat.

children.name: pale sunshine
children.definition: not strong or hot
examples: It was early spring, and pale sunshine shone on the fields.

children.name: hazy sunshine
children.definition: sunshine with air that is not clear because of mist etc
examples: Tomorrow morning it'll be dry with hazy sunshine.

children.name: a ray of sunshine
examples: A ray of sunshine filtered through the dirty window.

children.name: daylight
children.definition: the natural light of day: ánh sáng ban ngày

children.name: in daylight
examples: I’d like to look at the house again in daylight.

children.name: daylight hoursthe time when it is light ban ngày
examples: The park is open during daylight hours.

children.name: sunlight
children.definition: natural light that comes from the sun :ánh sáng mặt trời, ánh nắng
examples: Her long blonde hair was shining in the sunlight.
We emerged from the dark forest into the sunlight.

children.name: the morning/afternoon/evening sunlight
examples: Their armour glinted in the early morning sunlight.

children.name: bright sunlight
examples: She shaded her eyes against the bright sunlight.

children.name: strong sunlight
examples: Don't expose babies under six months to strong sunlight.

children.name: direct sunlight
examples: This plant prefers to be kept out of direct sunlight.

children.name: dappled sunlight
children.definition: when sunlight comes through trees
examples: the dappled sunlight of the forest

children.name: the fading sunlight
examples: We sat in the fading sunlight of the early evening.

children.name: sunlight streams/pours somewhere
children.definition: a lot comes in
examples: Mabel pulled back the curtains, and sunlight streamed in.

children.name: sunlight filters somewhere
children.definition: a little comes in
examples: The canopy of leaves allows some sunlight to filter through.

children.name: sth shines/sparkles/glitters etc in the sunlight
examples: His newly polished buttons glittered in the sunlight.

children.name: a shaft/ray/beam of sunlight
examples: A shaft of sunlight illuminated the left side of his face.

children.name: light
children.definition: a) the energy from the Sun, a flame, a lamp etc that allows you to see things : ánh sáng
examples: We saw a flash of light.
b)[C] a particular type of light, with its own particular colour, level of brightness etc : ánh sáng
The colours look different in different lights.

children.name: bright/strong
examples: The light was so bright he had to shut his eyes.

children.name: blinding/dazzling
children.definition: extremely bright
examples: The white buildings reflected a blinding light.

children.name: dim
children.definition: not bright
examples: Gradually her eyes became accustomed to the dim light.

children.name: good
children.definition: bright enough
examples: Stand over here where the light is good.

children.name: poor/bad
children.definition: not bright enough
examples: The light was too poor for me to read.

children.name: soft/warm
children.definition: light that seems slightly yellow or orange
examples: the soft light of the candles

children.name: cold/harsh
children.definition: light that seems slightly blue
examples: the cold light of the moon

children.name: the morning/dawn light
examples: The flowers glowed brightly in the morning light.

children.name: natural light
children.definition: light produced by the sun
examples: The only natural light came from two high windows.

children.name: artificial light
children.definition: light produced by lamps
examples: The office was windowless, lit only by artificial light.

children.name: light shines
examples: The light from the streetlamp shone through the curtains.

children.name: light comes from somewhere
examples: The only light came from the fire.

children.name: light streams/floods in
children.definition: a large amount of light comes in
examples: Light streamed in through the window.

children.name: light falls on/across etc something
examples: The light fell on her book.

children.name: light illuminates somethingformal
children.definition: makes it bright or able to be seen
examples: The light from the screen illuminated the people gathered round it.

children.name: the light is fading
children.definition: it is getting darker as the sun is going down

children.name: produce light
children.definition: alsoemit lighttechnical
examples: the light produced by the sun

children.name: cast light
children.definition: send light onto something
examples: the gold circle of light cast by the lamp

children.name: reflect light
examples: Snow reflects a lot of light.

children.name: sth is bathed in lightliterary
children.definition: something has a lot of light shining on it
examples: The fields and woods were bathed in golden light.

children.name: a beam/ray/shaft of light
children.definition: a thin line of light
examples: There was a shaft of light from the doorway.

children.name: a flash of light
children.definition: a bright light that appears suddenly for a very short time
examples: A flash of light caught his attention.

children.name: a pool/circle of light
children.definition: an area of light
examples: They stood in the pool of light cast by the streetlamp.

children.name: in/by the light of sth
examples: Everything looked grey in the dim light of the oil lamp.
I read by the light of the fire.

children.name: in/into the light
examples: The man moved forward into the light.

children.name: fade
children.definition: (to cause) to lose brightness gradually : mờ đi, tối đi
examples: They arrived home just as the light was fading (= as it was going dark) .
the fading evening light
a pair of faded jeans
The sun had faded the curtains.

children.name: starlight
children.definition: the light produced by stars : ánh sao
examples: his face looked pale in the starlight
the telescope separates starlight into its spectral components

children.name: moonlight
children.definition: the light from the moon:ánh trăng
examples: The trees looked strangely white in the moonlight.
Moonlight came in through the curtains, lighting up the children’s sleeping faces.

children.name: in the moonlight
examples: The water looked silver in the moonlight.

children.name: pale/silver moonlight
examples: The hills were bathed in pale moonlight.

children.name: by moonlight
examples: We dined by moonlight.

children.name: candlelight
children.definition: the light that a candle produces when it is burning : ánh nến
examples: The jewels sparkled in the candlelight.

children.name: by candlelight
examples: We ate by candlelight.

children.name: firelight
children.definition: the light produced by a fire, especially one in a fireplace: ánh lửa
examples: The room glowed in the firelight.

children.name: lamplight
children.definition: literary light from a lamp, especially light which is not very bright and only shines over a small area : ánh đèn
examples: Her eyes shone in the lamplight.

children.name: in the lamplight
examples: She studied the pale skin of his facein thedim lamplight.

children.name: floodlight
children.definition: a very bright light that is used to light the outside of a building or sports ground at night: ánh sáng đèn pha
examples: The church was lit up by floodlights.

children.name: under floodlights
examples: The game will be played under floodlights.
This evening's match will be playedunderfloodlights.

children.name: torchlight
children.definition: the light from a torch : ánh sáng đuốc
examples: a torchlight procession
in the torchlight
I saw the blade of an open knife shine in his handinthe torchlight.
